title: 110_s1672
content: The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes the Visual Impairment and Orientation and Mobility Professionals Education Assistance Program under Chapter 80 of title 38, United States Code. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes a scholarship program to provide financial assistance for individuals studying visual impairment or orientation and mobility at accredited educational institutions in a State. The scholarship program established under the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 aims to increase the number of qualified blind rehabilitation specialists for the Department and the Nation. The Secretary will promote the program to educational institutions nationwide, with a focus on reaching Hispanic students and Historically Black Colleges and Universities. To participate, individuals must submit an application and agreement to the Secretary. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 establishes a scholarship program for blind rehabilitation specialists. Participants agree to serve in the Department in exchange for educational assistance. The Secretary provides application and agreement forms with details on rights, liabilities, terms, and conditions. Upon approval, individuals are notified in writing. The scholarship program for blind rehabilitation specialists established by the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 requires individuals to serve in the Department in exchange for educational assistance. The Secretary determines the amount of financial assistance necessary to cover tuition and fees for participants, with additional assistance allowed to supplement other educational aid. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 provides educational assistance to individuals, with a maximum amount of $15,000 for full-time students and a maximum of $45,000 overall. Assistance is provided based on the ratio of coursework for part-time students. The Secretary determines the duration of assistance. The Secretary may provide financial assistance to an individual for up to six years under the VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007. An agreement between the Secretary and a participant must be in writing and include the terms of financial assistance and academic requirements. The VA Vision Scholars Act of 2007 allows financial assistance for up to six years to individuals who meet academic requirements and agree to work for the Department for three years after completing the program. Repayment is required if the individual fails to meet the agreement terms. The Secretary may require repayment of unearned assistance if the individual fails to meet agreement terms, with exceptions allowed. Regulations will determine the repayment amount and circumstances for exceptions. Waiver or suspension of obligations may be granted in certain circumstances beyond the individual's control. The Secretary may require repayment of unearned assistance if agreement terms are not met, with exceptions allowed. Waiver or suspension of obligations may be granted in certain circumstances determined to be in the best interest of the United States. Repayment to the Secretary is considered a debt owed to the United States, not discharged by bankruptcy within five years of agreement termination. Clerical amendments are made to title 38. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must implement chapter 80 of title 38, United States Code within six months of this Act's enactment.
